text: the internet boom in the last two to three years has sent information technology it companies tripping over each other to spot the next money-making trend and they seem to have zeroed in on the same idea -- business transactions over the net `` electronic commerce '' and `` e-business '' are the latest buzzwords at leading it companies including ibm corp and digital equipment corp where engineers are trying to come up with an array of choices for people and companies to buy and sell in cyberspace at the internet world international conference held in singapore in late january speeches workshops exhibitions and meetings with the media centred on the promise of electronic commerce the push factors while the debate rages on over just how useful and profitable electronic commerce can be it companies are not waiting for the dust to settle `` the technology is n't perfect but the business incentive is so compelling it 's worth the risk the biggest risk is to do nothing '' rose ann giordano digital 's vice president internet business group said in her keynote address the expectation that a huge number of people will be surfing the net is pushing companies in that direction `` close to 40 million people are expected on-line by year 's end '' said john patrick ibm 's vice president of internet technology `` how will businesses take advantage of the ability to reach an increasing number of people around the world via the internet and intranets `` e-business is what will change the economies of the world it will allow businesses to reach out to touch constituencies they could n't before '' he said ibm has identified three areas in e-business -- ways to conduct commerce business collaboration and managing content on the internet question on profit and usefulness analysts say the stage is set for electronic commerce but it may not prove to be immediately profitable for businesses operating in cyberspace `` i see the basic infrastructure for this business is already there but i do n't see it being profitable so soon '' said patrick yau technology analyst at schroders securities ibm launched its virtual shopping mall called world avenue in the last quarter of 1996 and now has about 15 merchants signed on it gets a start-up fee from the vendors a five percent commission on sales and a monthly maintenance charge some critics say such a retailing concept does not add much value other than the convenience of shopping from home `` malls on the internet are not what people want '' said stan dolberg a forrester research analyst in a reuter report `` if they want a mall they want products grouped together by categories say like shoes so they can comparison shop ... the internet itself is like a whole mall where a lot of different things are already grouped together '' he said other recent internet shopping mall efforts have also failed like mci communications corp 's mci marketplace while ibm conceded it was too early to tell if its virtual mall would succeed it said one advantage was that people would be able to shop as and when they liked even when shops were closed `` we are thinking of doing a poll at one of the large malls to ask if people really enjoy shopping at the mall itself '' said patrick technologies in the pipeline ibm hopes to license a project called panoramix currently being tested which gives a three-dimensional experience be it in a shop or a museum the consumer can view products close up and effect a purchase through a simple point and click digital is demonstrating millicent a technology that allows low-value transactions credit card companies normally would not accept and the network computer which the industry is banking on to help boost electronic commerce will be rolled out from the first half of this year software company oracle corp champions the network computer -- a simple and cheap device that pulls data from a network -- as the way to get computer-shy people onto the net as it would look and work like a consumer device for instance a television set security and cost companies say hurdles like security bandwidth and regulation have already been crossed or would soon be resolved the major barrier is gaining people 's trust that it is safe to do business over the net ibm and digital say that with techniques such as encryption now available it is as safe if not safer to transact over the net than over the telephone at the end of the day the lure of electronic commerce is that it provides new ways of doing business at a lower cost `` small businesses will have a global reach which they could n't have before vendors can go directly to customers and cut out the middlemen '' said giordano businesses can exist without buildings and with fewer staff resulting in lower overheads inventory levels can be cut yau of schroders said banks would probably be the first to adopt electronic commerce in a big way as they were the ones who had the financial resources to invest in the technology analysts say electronic commerce will only really take off when people find the net as comfortable as using the telephone will a parallel economy emerge in cyberspace the debate goes on

boeing co. friday appointed long-time executive richard pearson to head the commercial aircraft operations acquired in its purchase of mcdonnell douglas corp pearson who joined boeing in 1967 led the company 's commercial airplane group transition team in the seven months leading up to the 16.3 billion merger which became effective friday pearson eventually will move to california to oversee the douglas products division formerly known as douglas aircraft co. which makes the md-80 md-90 md-95 and md-11 airplanes at plants in orange county the long-term fate of those models is uncertain although boeing chairman phil condit said last week he saw potential for derivatives of the new md-95 that would be smaller than any plane the company currently offers walter orlowski who had served as president of douglas aircraft will move to seattle to become a vice president in boaing 's commercial airplane group boeing has not yet made any announcements about management of its defence and space operations which constitute the bulk of the assets acquired in the merger a company spokesman said `` no consensus '' was reached on whether the operations will be based in seattle or st. louis where fighter jets including the f-15 and f/a 18 are manufactured a reorganization also is possible alan mulally the recently appointed president of boeing 's defence and space operations is on vacation and will not take part in any of the `` day one '' celebrations planned for monday at 40 boeing sites across the country a spokesman said

canadian bond rating service said on tuesday that it had upgraded the rating outlook of canadian national railway company to positive and kept a b++ high investment rating on the company 's debentures and notes cbrs said the rating on cn 's pass-through certificates was one-notch higher at a low because of collateral value and the nature of assets `` the upgrade in the rating outlook reflects the significant operational improvements achieved by cn since its privatisation in 1995 '' cbrs said `` owing to the continued progress in cn 's operating characteristics and sound financial performance the company is poised to extend its earnings and cash flow in 1997 '' cbrs added paul simao reuters toronto bureau 416 941-8104

a recent flip-flop in indian aviation policy barring foreign airlines from taking stakes in the domestic sector sends worrisome signals about the pace of economic reform analysts and businessmen said on sunday prime minister h.d deve gowda 's crisis-ridden cabinet on tuesday prohibited foreign airlines from taking stakes in domestic ventures though it let other foreign investors in `` this decision will send out negative signals just as the government was doing fine on other economic fronts '' said v. raghuraman secretary-general of the associated chambers of commerce and industry assocham a direct casualty of the new rule is a proposed tie-up between india 's largest business group the tatas and singapore airlines to set up a 600 million domestic network `` it 's a case of india shooting itself in the foot very few airlines can stand alone nowadays a monopoly situation causes all sorts of inefficiencies '' said graham hayward executive director of the singapore international chamber of commerce the tatas planned to take a 60 percent stake in the airline and sia the rest according to a february 1995 proposal which the government sat on for two years it became the focus of a high-profile battle by civil aviation minister c.m ibrahim to protect state-run airlines air-india which operates on international routes and indian airlines which flies domestic routes `` i think it 's very sectoral they do n't want to liberalise the airline sector for whatever reason but that does n't mean that in other sectors they wo n't do that '' said dilip ratha senior economist at w.i carr stockbrokerage in singapore he said it would not make foreign investors more cautious about india because they were already very cautious india hopes to attract 10 billion in foreign direct investment annually over the next few years mainly to improve its overburdened infrastructure to support economic growth of around seven percent a year foreign direct investment approvals totalled 26.7 billion between august 1991 and december 1996 and in the nine months april to december 1996 the figure was only marginally up on the 1.5 billion for the same period a year earlier a strategist with a foreign investment bank said there were still grounds for hope that the civil aviation ministry will drop its objections to foreign airlines entering india 's market `` if one looks at it coolly it is probably just a short-term phenomenon the result of animosity between the industry minister and the civil aviation minister '' he said indian airlines is closer to moving into the black on friday it reported a 1996/97 net loss of 407.5 million rupees against a loss of 1.09 billion 1995/96 it forecast net profit in 1997/98 at 953 million rupees the cabinet also limited foreign firms that are not airlines to 40 percent equity stakes in domestic airlines the moves have radically affected jet airways india 's largest private airline in which two foreign airlines have stakes gulf air holdings and kuwait airways each have 20 percent stakes valued at 4 million in jet airways whose fleet of 12 aircraft operates 74 flights each day to 23 destinations jet airways would divest its foreign equity an airline official told reuters `` the policy decision has been taken we will also disinvest and go by the government requirements '' he said the government has fixed a six-month deadline for divestment no other country allowed international carriers to operate its domestic services said an aviation analyst who did not want to be named `` why should india be any different '' he asked india began opening its aviation sector to private enterprise under an economic liberalisation programme launched by then prime minister p.v narasimha rao in 1991 a dozen domestic airlines quickly sprang up but were winnowed down to a handful by crippling fuel and maintenance costs low occupancy rates and government laws that force them to fly to remote unprofitable regions last year the civil aviation ministry began reviewing policies governing foreign equity stakes in domestic airlines india 's creaking infrastructure has also slowed growth in air traffic

kansas city power light co said sunday that it continues to recommend that shareholders not tender their shares to western resources inc kcpl said that unless western determines to let its exchange offer terminate it will be required to extend its offer from time to time for a `` substantial '' period of time kcpl said that western 's offer has been open since july and that since then a little more than 40 percent of the company 's shares outstanding were tendered to western earlier on sunday western resources said that more than 44 percent of kcpl shares have been tendered and that it has extended its offer deadline to novemer 15 1996

belgian investment bank de maertelaere nv said on wednesday it would open an office in the town of sint-niklaas it will be the ninth office for ghent-based de maertelaere which is 50 percent family-owned formerly a brokerage it became a bank in may -- brussels newsroom +32 2 287 6815 fax +32 2 230 7710
shares in softbank corp gained on bargain hunting on friday morning after declining sharply in previous sessions the shares were up 100 yen at 8,600 yen at 0159 gmt on the over-the-counter market

c.h heist corp said on wednesday it would delay the planned spin-off of its ablest service corp unit through initial public offering until later this year the company said market conditions were unfavorable for an ipo of its size based on the investment bank advice it decided to wait president c.h heist said `` ablest will continue to aggressively pursue acquisitions and open new offices in strategic markets where the company currently does not have a presence '' he said that should provide critical mass needed to complete an ipo on terms originally planned ablest is a temporary staffing company c.h heist corp provides industrial services including cleaning insulation and maintenance new york newsdesk 212-859-1610

dain bosworth said analyst dean ramus downgraded multiple zones international inc to hold from buy -- cut earnings per share estimates to 0.32 from 1.00 for fiscal 1997 and lowered fiscal 1998 to 0.43 from 1.19 -- cited company 's announcement late wednesday that it expects its second quarter sales to be at least 15 percent below the sequential first quarter level and to post a loss for the quarter including a charge -- the stock was off 3-1/2 to 5

poland 's privatisation ministry will sign a formal agreement with its advisor in the sale of the polar sa white goods maker by the end of the month privatisation minister wieslaw kaczmarek said on thursday in august poland picked a consortium of bank handlowy w warszawie sa and a polish consortium firm access to advise in the privatisation the state-owned polar said earlier this week it planned to offer more than 70 million zlotys worth of new stock to the public and to enter the warsaw bourse in the first half of 1997 the company which makes refrigerators freezers and washing machines said it would not seek a strategic investor in the near future but did not rule out an alliance with another renowned producer later -- warsaw newsroom +48 22 653 9700

tennessee gas pipeline co said wednesday it plans to form a joint venture with mcn investment corp to build a liquefied natural gas facility on the delmarva peninsula near delaware 's border with maryland the proposed 40 to 50 million project would provide liquefaction storage and vaporization services beginning in early 2000 according to tennessee gas the el paso energy corp subsidiary said it and the mcn energy group inc subsidiary would equally onw the venture continental states peaking services llc `` depending on the level of interest shown by potential customers in our open season this facility could provide between ome and two billion cubic feet equivalent of natural gas storage service which equates to peak-day withdrawal capacity of 100 to 200 million cubic feet per day of revaporized natural gas '' mcn investment chief executive rai bhargava said the planned facility would be directly connected to the eastern shore natural gas pipeline system with access to the williams cos inc 's transcontinental gas pipe line and columbia gas transmission systems several northeast satellite lng storage facilities also could be supplied by this facility mcn spokesman stewart lawrence said `` pipeline capacity into this region is severely constrained during the peak winter months but generally available in the warmer months noted john somerhalder president of tennessee gas pipeline `` the continental states facility will allow customers to store lower-cost gas in the market area and have it ready for reliable delivery when it 's needed most '' open season for the joint project begins at 0800 edt/1200 gmt june 18 and ends 1700 edt/2100 gmt july 25 the project 's size capacity and feasibility will be based on the open season results tennessee gas pointed out following the completion of a successful open season continental states plans to file for federal energy regulatory commission approval of the project -- new york newsdesk 212-859-1610

the u.s. justice department said thursday it has had `` talks '' with nationwide mutual insurance co. which has been accused of discriminating against minorities in selling homeowner policies in urban neighbourhoods `` we are engaged in talks with nationwide regarding allegations of discrimination '' spokeswoman lee douglass said in a telephone interview `` the talks have been constructive '' asked if a full-scale investigation is under way she said the department does not confirm or deny any investigations columbus ohio-based nationwide the sixth largest u.s. property/casualty insurer said it was reviewing its urban marketing strategy the company plans a news conference friday `` we are evaluating whether our underwriting guidelines constitute a barrier to our gaining market share in urban markets '' nationwide spokesman john millen said in a telephone interview late thursday a non-profit organisation the national fair housing alliance said nationwide makes it difficult or costly for homeowners in predominantly african-american hispanic or integrated urban neighbourhoods to insure their homes the group had homeowners in such neighbourhoods ask insurers for information then had owners of comparable homes in mostly white suburban neighbourhoods do the same `` our investigations have shown that nationwide has engaged in discrimination in several ways '' executive director shanna smith said in a telephone interview for example an urban home might cost two to three times as much to insure as its suburban counterpart in some areas nationwide would not insure homes valued at less than 60,000 or limit coverage on homes built before 1950 she said `` that had a greater impact on integrated and minority neighbourhoods '' since many urban homes are older and valued at less than similar suburban homes she said nationwide 's millen said its age and valuation guidelines were based on traditional industry standards nationwide insurance enterprise 's property and casualty companies including nationwide mutual are separate business units from a life insurance unit nationwide financial services inc. which plans a public offering of stock

at t corp said on wednesday that wireline services revenue grew three percent in the fourth quarter of 1996 to 11.54 billion while wireless services revenue grew 18.4 percent to 937 million for the quarter communications services revenue increased 529 million or 4.3 percent from the same period last year communications services revenues include wireline services wireless services as well as communications products and other services wireless subscribers grew 31.7 perent to 5.2 million from a year ago including 900,000 digital subscribers `` we remain committed to growing our core business investing wisely in the future and ultimately building long-term value for our owners '' said chairman robert allen at t said that one rate a flat 15 cents per minute long distance calling plan had been well received and was meeting at t 's expectation for reducing customer churn financial services had an operating loss of 4 million for the quarter compared with operating profit of 109 million a year ago revenues fell 32.3 percent from a year ago however this was an improvement from the third quarter 1996 when an operating loss of 35 million was recorded the improvement on the third quarter at the unit was due to lower costs with expenses falling 15 percent the fall in revenues was caused mainly by a securitization program begun in 1995 which almost doubled securitized receivables to 6.5 billion in 1996 total financial services receivables were 13.5 billion on 18.3 million customer accounts at the end of the fourth quarter revenues from communication products and other products which includes outsourcing and consulting online and wireless product sales were 17 percent up at 386 million in the quarter from a year ago nick louth new york newsroom 212 859 1712

fai insurances ltd expects profits to continue to grow in the future fai director and chief financial officer timothy mainprize said at a roadshow in singapore on wednesday `` our profits will continue to improve over the next few years '' mainprize told potential investors in the insurance company 's recently announced us 75 million floating rate note in february chief executive rodney adler said in a statement the company should maintain profit growth in the absence of abnormal events in the insurance field the company 's net profit for the first half ended december 31 rose by 35.4 percent to australian 7.7 million mainprize noted the company 's claims paying ability was upgraded by standard and poor 's corp last october to an investment-grade bbb-minus `` we are reasonably confident that we shall be upgraded up again '' he said he said fai was talking with a large u.s. insurer -- which he did not identify -- about the possibility of entering into an agreement to market information technology insurance

the world 's second longest suspension bridge is due to be officially opened this weekend amid concern among hong kong 's air cargo industry about the `` unthinkable '' industry sources told reuters the hk 7.1 billion eight lane double-deck road and rail bridge is the spectacular centre piece of the lantau link which includes two other bridges and viaducts it will open for traffic on may 22 it is the only land connection between the territory 's new chek lap kok airport off lantau island and the rest of hong kong industry sources fear if the link were ever cut the airport would be paralysed and hong kong 's economy immediately affected cargo sources said last year 's channel tunnel fire showed how disaster can easily strike and cause months of chaos for cargo operators security concerns at the new bridge were raised earlier this week when electrical wires were cut in 32 places already tight security has been strengthened according to officials a barge derrick crashing into a nearby bridge last year also raised safety concerns a hong kong government spokesman said the chances of the bridge ever having to close were `` very very remote '' he said it was typhoon-proof and road traffic could switch to the enclosed lower deck but said `` unforeseen things can happen '' a private company has been given the contract to ensure traffic flows smoothly along the entire tsing ma control area he added in the event of the `` worst case scenario '' with a total bridge closure the spokesman said contingency measures are being drawn up for passenger ferries to be requisitioned and replace the express rail service which will also use the bridge as yet there are no provisions for cargo handling `` if the worst comes to the worst passengers are the priority we have no contingency plan for cargo yet '' he said in an interview with hong kong handling record amounts of cargo up to 5,700 tonnes in one day it is doubtful whether any contingency measures would be able to handle just a fraction of the daily total industry sources said yeung kwok keung deputy managing director of hong kong air cargo terminals ltd which will operate the superterminal one air cargo terminal at chek lap kok said this week 's wire cutting sabotage had been helpful in raising security concerns `` it does not bear thinking about that the airport operation will be reliant on anything other than the bridge link if in the unlikely unwelcome and unfortunate event of the link being cut off and with the sea-based contingency plan in operation i have no doubt whatsoever that the impact on flight movements will be very significant '' yeung told reuters with thousands of consignments being handled every day the terminal would quickly clog up with incoming cargo and run out of storage space aircraft bound for hong kong would then have to be turned away and departing flights could leave empty yeung said `` the cargo industry has to look at and consider the likely impact on their trade of such a long cut off and it is something which we will be looking at it is a general concern but we are not terrified as yet at the prospect of such a disconnection because we do believe that the possibility is low to the extreme '' yeung added an airline operators committee source which represents all airlines airport managers and ground handling managers said he is also concerned `` i believe the issue is so important not just for airlines air freight forwarders but for the hong kong economy as a whole that some contingency measures should be drawn up '' he added at 1,377 metres long it is the world 's second longest suspension bridge after the humber bridge in england according to the new airport projects coordination office former british prime minister lady thatcher will officiate at this week 's opening ceremony

transaction charges for trading gas on the uk spot market may rise from 1.50 stg to 2.75 stg under a plan put forward at a meeting of the claims validation agency which confirms that gas has actually been delivered after a transaction new general manager of claims validation services ltd charles mason-smith said that at a meeting on monday approval was given to seek member 's agreement to raise the transaction charge by this level this applies for each transaction so that if a company transacts for example 25,000 therms a day of gas for a month of 31 days then the transaction charge is payable 31 times mason-smith said he could not be sure when the new charge may start to apply otherwise he said the meeting renewed director 's contracts and discussed `` some general bits of business '' -- sebastian alison london newsroom +44 171 542 6412

canada 's eldorado gold corp ltd said on tuesday that a proposed 193.6 million deal with south africa 's gencor ltd had been called off due to market conditions `` ... due to current market conditions eldorado and gencor ltd have been unable to satisfactorily renegotiate the proposed transaction previously announced on june 5 1997 '' eldorado said in a statement `` as a result the proposed transaction will not proceed '' it added gencor announced june 5 that it had signed a memorandum of understanding with eldorado gold corp in terms of which eldorado would acquire a portfolio of mining and development and exploration assets in ghana and south africa in a deal valued at 193.6 million an eldorado spokesman told reuters current market conditions referred mainly to the recent weakness in the gold price gold fell to a 12-year low of 314 an ounce in early july and has made little progress beyond 330 since then it was trading at around 323 an ounce in late london trade on tuesday gencor declined to comment on the announcement and said a statement would be released on wednesday eldorado said it would continue to develop its ongoing relationship with the new gencor ltd gencor recently split itself into base metals arm billiton plc and a gold company gencor ltd -- eldorado 's largest shareholder `` eldorado intends to concentrate its activities on its present operations development projects and priority exploration properties '' the company added -- johannesburg newsroom +27 11 482-1003 e-mail johannesburg.newsroom reuters.com

the future of a popular tourist spot -- the bureau of engraving and printing plant near the mall -- as well as vast potential cost savings are at stake in the fight over a new u.s. 1 coin `` eliminating the one-dollar note could substantially reduce and possibly eliminate the need for a washington d.c. production plant '' the general accounting office said thursday in a look at coinage and money-printing operations bill printing could be consolidated in fort worth texas if a 1 coin were issued in place of the note gao officials said they said the bureau preferred to have a back-up plant but had not decided whether to replace the washington plant the bureau of engraving and printing says 700,000 people a year visit the plant which prints bills in denominations from 1 to 100 members of a house banking subcommittee were skeptical a 1 coin would be a success given the lackluster record of the susan b. anthony dollar coin nor were some of them ready to stop producing the 1 bill a key premise in gao 's estimate that the 1 coin would save 456 million a year in costs coins can last 30 years but paper notes must be replaced every 16 months at government expense `` these are not false savings '' said michael motley gao associate director for government business operations who said other nations successfully converted to coins `` well fine you run on that platform '' retorted rep. joe kennedy a massachusetts democrat public acceptance of a 1 coin could rise motley said if it had a distinctive color or if a new design was adopted the anthony coin honoring the women 's sufferage leader was faulted as too similar in size and appearance to the 25-cent coin the u.s. mint no longer produces the anthony dollar but has a three-year supply stockpiled it estimates it would take 30 months to develop and begin production of a new 1 coin if congress ordered it gao said the mint could resume production of the anthony dollar if supplies ran out and a new 1 coin was not ordered but rep. floyd flake new york democrat said paper notes were lighter and easier to carry than 1 coins he was not mollified by a suggestion that more 2 bills could be printed if a 1 coin was mandated `` it 's a pain in the butt to carry all those coins in your pocket '' flake said in the past five years the 1 bill accounted for 47 percent of notes produced by the bureau of engraving and printing it could cost 73 million to gear up to produce a 1 coin according to the mint a new bill-printing plant could cost from 158 million to 250 million

poland 's bank przemyslowo-handlowy sa will on june 2 increase credit rates on already existing loans by two percentage points after the central bank raised obligatory reserves on zloty term deposits bph said on monday bph said it would leave deposit rates unchanged and increase credit rates on new loans as of may 6 from april 30 the central bank increased the mandatory reserve requirement on zloty term deposits by two points to 11 percent and reserves on foreign currency deposits by one point to five percent to cool quickly growing domestic demand -- warsaw newsroom +48 22 653 9700

riscorp inc said on tuesday james malone has resigned as president and chief operating officer malone 's duties will be assumed by chief executive frederick dawson who also was named president riscorp said also richard franz has resigned as senior vice president and chief financial officer and will be replaced by stephen rece senior vice president and head of the company 's reinsurance department riscorp said riscorp was not immediately available for further comment last week the company announced plans to reduce its workforce and focus its operations on the managed workers compensation insurance business the company has not yet filed its 10-k annual report for 1996 and its first quarter 10-q report with the securities and exchange commission riscorp declined to disclose a reason for the resignations tuesday 10 june 1997 20:38:39 ends nn10239403

gulf canada resources ltd plans to sell a major northern alberta oil and gas property it acquired last year to fund the paydown of stampeder exploration ltd 's debt gulf chief executive j.p. bryan said on monday bryan said he believed the property which pumps out about 12,500 barrels of oil equivalent a day could fetch between c 350 million and c 400 million the sale and gulf 's planned public offering of its indonesia assets provide enough cash to pay down debt to a level where gulf 's credit could be investment grade he said stampeder target of a c 1 billion friendly takeover by gulf has long-term debt of about c 300 million `` when we do the asamera transaction we anticipate taking another c 400-500 million off our canadian debt and bringing it down below c 2 billion '' bryan said `` so we think that based on cash flow multiples debt-to-equity will be in a very comfortable range and remove once and for all the conversation about our balance sheet we should definitely be inverstment grade at that point in time '' gulf made a major purchase last year from pennzoil co last year to beef up its land position at zama/virgo it plans to market the offering of the gulf indonesia resources ltd formerly asamera through september bryan said the gulf share issue tied to the stampeder purchase would increase its number of shares outstanding by about 25 percent but he said he expected the effects of the dilution would be reduced by several opportunities within stampeder 's asset base besides heavy oil which would be folded into gulf 's heavy oil sands assets to form a new public company that could acquire more heavy oil assets worldwide stampeder 's oil and gas marketing assets would also fit nicely with gulf 's own he said he also said gulf could blend stampeder 's light oil production to its heavy oil to reduce the effects of current wide light-heavy spreads bryan said gulf was paying between c 5 and c 5.50 per barrel of oil equivalent for its stampeder 's oil and gas reserves those totalled 98 million barrels of proven reserves and 143 million barrels of proven and probable reserves at the end of 1996 he also said the price represented just under five times stampeder 's expected 1998 cash flow stampeder 's production in the first quarter was about 32,000 barrels of oil equivalent a day indluding 25,000 barrels of oil and liquids and 75 million cubic feet of gas a day jeffrey jones reuters calgary bureau 403 531-1624

south korea 's daewoo electronics chairman bae soon-hoon wants to know the `` real reason '' behind the french government 's decision to suspend the sale of electronics group thomson sa a company spokesman said on thursday `` we are trying to find out the real reason behind the french government 's announcement of temporarily suspending the privatisation process '' spokesman park sung-il quoted the chairman as saying `` we 'll closely examine and confront any development to the situation '' the daewoo chairman added `` we do n't know yet what the french government 's position is from the information we 've received so far but it 's difficult to conclude that the privatisation plan has been put off completely '' bae said he said considering the french government 's international credibility daewoo electronics plan to take over thomson multimedia was unlikely to face too big a change the french government said on wednesday the suspension of the proposed thomson sell-off to lagardere groupe was due to objections to the planned sale of the company 's consumer electronics unit to daewoo several thousand workers of thomson multimedia marched in paris and other cities on november 20 to protest against the sale fearing for their jobs and working conditions -- seoul newsroom 822 727 5643

spain 's repsol is expected to post flat to weaker first quarter profits this week with good performances from all business divisions except for gas which will weigh on overall results analysts said on monday they forecast net attributable profit at between 33 and 36 billion pesetas in the first quarter versus 35.41 billion pesetas in the first quarter of 1996 operating profit is expected to do better rising to 60 billion pesetas at most versus 53.12 billion pesetas in the year-ago period at the core level profits will be boosted by what may be up to triple the level of earnings in the exploration and production division boosted by a stronger dollar versus the peseta an increase in the price of crude increased production and the incorporation of the purchase of astra one analyst at pakistani textile stocks have soared in the last two trading sessions in anticipation of a government relief package but analysts said on wednesday they saw no major turnaround in their earnings `` there has been an unprecedented rise in textile stocks in the last two trading sessions on the news that the government plans a relief package but people have over-reacted '' ing baring securities analyst amir paracha said baring 's daily preview said the all pakistan textile mills association aptma had urged the new caretaker government of prime minister meraj khalid to remove import charges on raw cotton and lower duties on the import of synthetic fibre ather rauf of carr mashriq said other demands of mill owners included a ban on cotton exports rescheduling loan repayments by troubled textile companies and concessions on utilities `` but most of these demands are economically unviable and if some are accepted even then we do not see any turnaround in textile companies '' he said rauf said the government 's textile reform package could be good for the economy as more than 60 percent of pakistan 's exports were cotton-based `` but we do not expect a turnaround in textile companies '' abid naqvi research chief at taurus securities said the government relief package would be in phases `` initially it will concentrate on the spinning sector and with time relief for value added sectors would be provided '' dealers said one reform package could not pull the textile companies out of trouble while most of them had years of accumulated losses naqvi said investors should take positions only in stocks with good track records and strong earning potential `` we recommend gadoon textiles and nishat mills which are trading at attractive earning levels '' he said `` the recovery of the textile sector will be a long process another taurus securities dealer zaina nowsherwan said `` most companies have five to six years of accumulated losses they can not bounce back in one year because of a single package '' she said most textile companies had not paid any dividend to

from now on jenny craig inc. must warn consumers its weight loss methods are usually only temporary the federal government said thursday the provision is one of several announced by the federal trade commission settling deceptive advertising charges brought against the weight loss company in 1993 claims in most ads will have to include the statement `` for many dieters weight loss is temporary '' jenny craig will also have to disclose the average weight loss maintenance for consumers the commission said the government agency also focused on testimonials based on experiences atypical of most jenny craig clients testimonials about highly successful maintenance of weight loss must now be accompanied by the phrase `` this result is not typical you may be less successful '' in the past some ads suggested dieters could lose all the weight they wanted for 49 although the actual costs could run into hundreds of dollars jenny craig must end that practice the commission said in a statement jenny craig said `` the consent agreement does not suggest the company violated any law or regulation and it does not involve payment by the company of any financial damages '' but jenny craig faces civil penalties of up to 11,000 per day if it fails to live up to its promises ftc spokeswoman bonnie jansen said jenny craig president c. joseph labonte said `` after nearly six years of discussions we 're pleased to put this matter behind us '' but apparently the settlement could have been reached years ago ftc spokeswoman jansen noted that similar settlements were reached in 1993 with three other weight loss companies jenny craig did not settle and charges were filed while the consent agreement itself makes no comment about the company 's past practices jansen noted that it settles charges of deceptive advertising `` jenny craig has agreed not to misrepresent the performance safety or customer endorsement of any weight loss programme and to have scientific data to back up future claims '' the ftc said the ftc vote was 4-0 the public will have 60 days to comment to the ftc office of the secretary 6th and pennsylvania ave. nw washington dc 20580 the public can also reach the ftc through the world wide web at http //www.ftc.gov similar charges against weight watchers were pulled from litigation a week ago pending the possibility of a settlement with the ftc

carolina power light co was enlisting help thursday from across the south to help it cope with what looks like an inevitable tangle of downed lines and trees as hurricane fran takes aim at the carolinas `` if the hurricane follows its current track we are the main utility in its way '' said carolina power spokeswoman sally ramey `` it 's a huge storm '' `` we have been in close contact with the national weather service and are expecting winds perhaps as strong as 125-140 miles per hour mph as it hits the coast '' she said `` the damage we are expecting is potentially much more than bertha in july '' ramey said referring to the hurricane that quickly brushed along north carolina 's coast in july `` but fran is a slow-moving storm so we may not be able to start assessing damage until late friday and probably wo n't know the full extent of it until sometime saturday because of the high winds and rain '' said ramey bertha at its peak left 225,000 of carolina power 's 1.1 million customers without power that customer base represents over three million residents in the carolinas most of them in central and eastern north carolina most at risk during the storm is carolina power 's 5,867 miles of transmission lines the high-voltage lines carrying power from generating facilities to local distribution networks and the neighborhood distribution lines themselves earlier thursday the company said it had shut down its 1,521 megawatt mw brunswick nuclear power facility in southport n.c. a site near north carolina 's southernmost and quite close to fran 's current path ramey said that despite the shutdown they saw no problems meeting demand which was estimated to peak today at only 7,000 mw because of cloud cover ahead of fran compared with about 9,000 mw during a typical hot summer day -- new york power desk 212 859 1621

motorola inc said wednesday it still expects a modest improvement in the worldwide semiconductor industry in 1997 but now sees growth of about six to eight percent versus 1996 in a conference call with analysts motorola said it reduced its industry growth forecast from the 10 percent it estimated after the company 's first quarter ed gams head of motorola 's investor relations said the united states and asian regions are the strongest but less semiconductor industry growth is seen in japan where the market is affected by the strong u.s. dollar gams said the pullback in the company 's estimate is due in part to the effect of the strong dollar translating foreign sales into u.s. dollars reduces the overall growth rate he said industry growth in chips used in communications and automotive applications will be double-digit but the company expects all other sectors to show single-digit growth late tuesday motorola reported second quarter net earnings of 0.44 a share versus 0.54 a share last year excluding a 170 million pretax charge for its exit of the struggling dynamic random access memory dram business earnings were 0.62 a share easily beating the analysts consensus estimate of 0.56 a share according to first call in its semiconductor division motorola reported sales were up 12 percent versus the first quarter and orders rose 18 percent gams said semiconductor prices were generally stable and it is reasonable to expect its segment 's operating margins will improve motorola 's percentage interest in iridium llc which plans a global satellite-based telecommunications network has decreased to about 21 percent from 24 percent as other investors entered the the consortium twelve of the planned 66 satellites are already in orbit and are performing well gams said and another five were launched today `` motorola expects to record an expense of approximately 65 million in 1997 in recognition of its share of iridium llc 's net loss for the year '' gams said adding the expense will be concentrated in the second half of the year and is due largely to depreciation of launched satellites `` in 1998 motorola expects to record a level of expense recognition of its share of iridium llc losses that is several times greater than the 65 million expected in 1997 '' he said gams said that in 1999 and beyond however motorola expects to recognize few or no iridium losses as motorola writes down its equity investment in iridium the pager group is continuing to be hit by tight inventory controls by paging operators gams said and motorola expects that will continue into 1998 second quarter pager and sales orders were significantly lower than last year it said -- chicago newsdesk 312-408-8787

india is expected to have nearly 750,000 mobile phone users by the end of 1997 more than triple the 260,000 users at the end of 1996 a senior official of nokia pvt ltd a unit of finland 's nokia oy said on monday `` our prediction is that the indian market will add 500,000 to 550,000 users in 1997 and will stand at about 750,000 by the end of the year '' parikshit bhasin joint managing director nokia pvt ltd told reuters after a news conference he said the market had received a boost with mobile phone services having started in india 's regional telephone zones increased sales of handsets in large cities and a fall in the number of smuggled handsets had also aided the trend he said mobile phones debuted in india in october 1995 in four cities -- delhi bombay madras and calcutta -- following an auction of cellular service licences by the government in 1992 regional licences for other zones were auctioned in 1995 and services began in most regions early this year bhasin said the key growth centres were still the four large cities where cellular phones had become a business tool and demand was steadily increasing he added nokia expected similar growth in the regions in the second quarter of 1998 meanwhile handset vendors had cut prices to smother the temptation of going for smuggled goods bhasin said `` last year nokia launched its 1610 model at 20,000 rupees 558.65 and its 8110 model at 42,000 rupees today the 1610 costs 13,000 rupees and the 8110 30,000 rupees '' he said bhasin said nearly 80 percent of all mobile phones available in india were priced below 15,000 rupees bhasin was speaking after the launch of nokia 's latest handphone 3810 which costs 18,125 rupees and has been specially designed for asia-pacific consumers -- sanjit singh new delhi newsroom 91 11-301-2024 fax 91 11-301-4043

soundview financial group said analyst scott randall raised his earnings per share estimates on linear technology corp -- raised fiscal 1998 to 2.17 from 2.09 and boosted fiscal 1999 to 2.70 from 2.60 -- kept short- and long-term buy ratings on the stock -- shares rose 3-3/4 to 62-1/4

automakers ended a strong 1996 with a whimper friday as general motors corp. said december u.s. car and truck sales fell nearly 14 percent and chrysler corp. managed a 1.1 percent sales gain for the month chrysler 's full-year sales of 2.45 million vehicles however broke the company 's 1988 record and the industry stayed on track to report full-year sales of 15.1 million cars and light trucks matching the 1994 total that was also its best year since 1988 automakers sold about 14.8 million cars and light trucks in the united states in 1995 `` it was a pretty good year as a whole but it 's closing on a soft note '' burnham securities analyst david healy said december sales from the 14 automakers who reported friday ran 8.6 percent below the year-ago results but full-year sales were up 1.8 percent analysts predicted that the seasonally adjusted annual sales rate for the month would be about 14.5 million to 14.8 million units compared with a strong december 1995 rate of 15.9 million units several japanese automakers also reported december sales declines on friday ford motor co. and honda motor co. ltd. are set to release year-end sales results on monday gm 's car sales fell 12.5 percent in december and normally stronger sales of gm trucks also fell a sharp 15.6 percent the december declines brought the auto giant 's full-year 1996 vehicle sales to 4,793,169 cars and trucks a 2.7 percent decline from the 4,895,368 units sold in 1995 gm 's sales for the year were marred by strikes that disrupted production in march late october and early november but analysts said car model changeovers and stiff competition in trucks also took a toll `` i think we 're past the point where you can use the strikes as an excuse '' healy said `` i think ford and chrysler are beginning to hurt gm in the truck area where its products are n't fresh any more '' still gm said truck sales for the full year exceeded 2 million units for the first time rising 2.8 percent over 1995 gm marketing chief ronald zarrella predicted gains in both cars and trucks in 1997 fueled by new sedans minivans and increased sport/utility vehicle producion `` the positive reception our new-for-'97 models are receiveing from both our dealers and customers is a certain sign that the coming year will be a good one for general motors and its dealers '' zarrella said in a statement gm 's market share has hovered near 30 percent in recent months continuing a steady decline over the past decade by contrast chrysler estimates that its market share increased by nearly 2 percentage points to nearly 16 percent bolstered by strong sales of minivans pickup trucks and sport/utility vehicles chrysler said its 1996 sales totaled 2,450,826 vehicles up 13 percent from 1995 's 2,164,343 it broke the previous annual record of 2,208,057 units set in 1988 chrysler said december sales of north american-built vehicles rose 5.4 percent but light truck sales dipped 0.2 percent in the month for the full year chrysler 's domestic car sales rose 6.6 percent to 827,941 units while light truck sales rose 16.7 percent 1,618,193 chrysler 's executive vice president of sales james holden said chrysler may have difficulty surpassing 1996 results this year in some months due to model changeovers he said the industry will still need incentives to maintain its sales pace `` i do n't see a way to wean ourselves completely from rebates and incentives but i expect to hold them to similar levels to what we 've had which have been relatively modest '' chrysler stock rose 50 cents to 34.625 while gm fell 62.5 cents to close at 57.875 both on the new york stock exchange among japanese automakers toyota motor corp. said december sales fell 17.4 percent while full-year sales rose 6.4 percent to 1.16 million units nissan motor corp. 's december sales dipped 0.2 percent and full-year sales fell 3.4 percent to 749,763 units mazda motor corp. 's december total was off 17.2 percent while annual sales fell 16.6 percent to 238,285 units germany 's volkswagen ag posted its best u.s. sales year since 1990 with sales up 17.3 percent to 135,907 cars and trucks december sales jumped 23.5 percent

time warner inc will tell its major shareholders this week that it plans to reduce its investment in the cable business as part of its efforts to cut down on its debt the wall street journal reported monday the newspaper said the company wants to reduce its interest in cable even if it is unable to reach an agreement with us west communications group which owns 25 percent of time warner entertainment the unit includes time warner cable the country 's second largest cable company with more than 11 million subscribers `` there are things we can do to lighten up cable without us west '' it quoted an unidentified senior company executive as saying the newspaper said time warner could either sell its interest in the cable systems that did not belong to its partnership with us west or spin them off completely

argentine bonds put in a strong performance monday helped by general flows into the latin american region although activity was still fairly slim `` the market rose with the whole region '' said a trader at a large foreign bank the market began to rise last week after several u.s. indicators showed moderating u.s. growth with market friendly argentine indicators released late friday and this session bonds were given an additional boost argentina 's frb due 2005 rose 3/4 to 83-6/8 while the local dollar-denominated bocon previsional 2 due 2001 rose 0.55 to 119.90 the economy ministry said monday consumer prices rose 0.5 percent in october from the previous month compared with 0.3 percent in october 1995 and 0.2 percent in september this year wholesale prices were up 0.5 percent compared with 0.2 percent in october last year and 1.2 percent a month earlier another trader said the market `` looks attractive at these levels '' before the gains in the market at the end of last week argentine bonds slumped for about 10 days as many investors booked profits after the large gains clocked up this year but the second trader reckoned that some investors may now be returning to the market particularly those that still have funds in cash to invest before the end of the year the economy ministry said friday tax revenue in october was 3.72 billion 12.5 percent higher than the same month a year earlier and 12.9 percent up on september in the money markets call money rates fell to 6.85 percent from 6.95 percent -- axel bugge buenos aires newsroom 541 3180668

following are views on the direction of philippine stocks on tuesday and main factors likely to affect trading investors are expected to remain defensive ahead of the federal reserve interest rate policy meeting traders said `` foreign investors are going back to blue chip countries like the u.s. and they are still underweighting the region our mettle is still being tested '' ramon adviento analyst at sun hung kai securities phils inc shares may move in a narrow range after three days of losses said elline salvatierra analyst at dharmala securities

a offering of 1 billion in new corporate bonds by rite aid corp was the main focus of the u.s. corporate bond market on tuesday as secondary market trading continued to be light traders said frank bergonzi chief financial officer at rite aid said the offering was increased to 1 billion from the original amount of 600 million as a result of particulary strong demand from investors rite aid will use the bulk of proceeds from the offering to refinance approximately 890 million of debt it assumed in connection with its recent acquisition of thrifty payless any remaining proceeds will be used to extend the maturity of existing rite aid debt bergonzi added he said `` we are pleased with the demand and ultimately the rates of the deal it lets us funnel our efforts fully into the intergration of thrifty payless instead of having to worry about additional financing '' the final offering consisted of 350 million of 6.70 percent five-year debt 300 million of 7.125 percent 10-year bonds and 300 million in 7.70 percent 30-year bonds goldman sachs co acted as lead underwriter for the deal a trader at another frim said investor demand was so strong for the rite aid offering becuase few issuers from the retail/industrial sector have tapped the market in recent weeks `` as opposed to the hundreds of millions of dollars of bank and finance paper we 've seen recently investors were jumping at a chance to get this paper '' elsewhere citicorp issued 300 million in capital securities due 2027 at a spread of 120 basis points over the treasury curve via a merrill lynch co inc led syndicate spreads across the investment grade market closed unchanged to treasuries amid light trading traders said the closing price on the benchmark 30-year treasury dropped 15/32 to 97-28/32 to yield 6.66 percent prices of high-yield bonds which tend to lag treasuries were off by 1/8 of a point on average a trader said this caused spreads on junk debt to tighten around five to six basis points he noted junk investors focused on trading of new issues on tuesday as volume in the broader secondary market remained low heartland wireless communications inc 's 125 million 14 percent senior notes due 2004 were bid at 102 near mid-session the deal by the rural wireless cable company priced at par after the market closed on monday bt securities corp was the underwriter tv filme 's 140 million in 12 7/8 percent senior notes traded up by 1/2 a point on tuesday after they were priced at par via bear stearns co inc on monday evening tv filme is a brazilian wireless cable services provider -- douglas brown 212-859-1662

rotterdam bunker prices were barely changed on monday despite barge market gains while prices in the med and middle east softened dealers said rotterdam 380 cst bunkers were quoted at around 86 fob barely changed from friday although barges trade reached that level before retreating slightly traders said volumes in both the barge and bunker markets were very thin bunker market trade amounted to some 5,000 tonnes most of which were supplied by majors hamburg bunkers were similarly quiet and also unchanged at around 93 fob in the mediterranean prices were mostly down by around 2 a tonne except for southern france where prices rose by 2 all ports were quiet egyptian fuel oil bunkers by also softened as on friday port said was dry and alexandria deliveries subject to enquiries -- amsterdam newsroom +31 20 504 5000

u.s. municipal bonds gained around one-eighth to one-quarter of a point aided by a report that showed inflation was surprisingly mild though concerns that dealers inventories were rising checked the gains the december municipal bond futures traded on the chicago board of trade outperformed the cash market rising 16 ticks to 114-20/32 they were slightly outpaced by u.s. treasury bond futures which climbed 20 ticks to 110-21/32 as a result the mob spread between the two futures continued to narrow slipping to 127 ticks scheduled competitive and negotiated municipal bond sales are expected to total 2.446 billion in 105 offerings for the week of oct 14 according to reuters municipal bond information group market players were stepping back from the market ahead of the release of the consumer price index on tuesday these data also are expected to show that inflation is not heating up as economists projected a 0.1 percent increase the possibility that the recent strength displayed by the stock market will continue to hold the attention of individual investors left municipal bond traders concerned that dealers were starting to accumulate too much inventory `` i think more bonds are in dealers hands than was once suspected '' a trader said he cited continued selling by institutional customers who are trying to improve the structure of their portfolios and the scarcity of cash held by municipal bond funds further the calender for new issues contains some sizable offerings in the next two weeks competitive sales total 1.097 billion in 63 offerings the largest issue is a 200 million massachusetts bay transportation authority obligation issue on oct 17 negotiated sales total 1.349 billion in 42 offerings the largest issue is a 375 million new york city municipal finance water authority bond offering through painewebber inc the new york city municipal water finance authority had been considering delaying the bond sale by one week but instead decided to go ahead with it on october 16 the negotiated calender also includes 175 million of ohio taxable revenue bonds among competitive offerings the market was looking ahead to two sales by bond sales by san francisco international airport the 165 million offering is subject to the alternative minimum tax and the 110 million sale is not actively quoted issues on friday included denver colorado city and county airport revenues of november 2025 which pay a 5-1/2 percent coupon they were offered at 5.75 percent net down six basis points from levels seen on thursday and north central texas health facilities development corp revenues of june 2021 which carry a 5-1/2 percent coupon were offered at 5.79 percent net down three basis points -- joan gralla 212-859-1654

european jet fuel was essentially steady with narrowly easier futures only impacting barges may ipe gas oil last traded 50 cents down at 162.25 traders said barge premiums were unchanged at may ipe 18 fob ara with one deal concluded at this level cargo premiums were a touch firmer with a bid of may ipe 23 cif nwe finding little offer interest lower than may ipe 24 `` the market is pretty much stuffed full with jet in storage and sellers are holding out for 24 '' said one trader who said the market was fundementally oversupplied a may swap was traded at 24.50 in the mediterranean eu grade was pegged unchanged at fob high quotes 8 with libyan 2-3 lower -- london newsroom +44 171 542 8980

south african shares got a late boost from u.s. data that appeared to ease inflation fears across the atlantic but stocks still ended down as diamond giant de beers took a hammering on reaction to its half-year results local shares had traded under a cloud throughout the day as the market nervously eyed wall street to see if the current downwards trend in new york was set to continue but lower-than-expected growth in july retail sales and the seventh straight month of lower producer prices saw a u.s. stocks rally that carried into other financial markets south african shares usually trade on their own merits but have followed new york closely all week in the absence of any significant local factors despite the publication of favourable producer price inflation figures on tuesday but dealers said though the data boosted hopes for an interest rate cut the move was already well-factored into the market and was providing support rather than any spur for major gains instead local sentiment took a knock from a hammering in bellwether share de beers as traders bailed out of the diamond giant in the wake of disappointing half year results the share ended down 850 cents to 154.50 rand in trade worth 122 million rand and the fall-out knocked 350 cents off sister firm anglo american which ended at 264.50 rand in business worth 28 million rand overall dealers said the day was modestly busy as a hectic afternoon session followed on the back of a tepid morning 's trade the total value of shares traded hit 805 million rands and the day saw 163 counters rise as 210 fell the all-share index drops 41.9 points to 7,538.0 as the industrials shed 24.6 points to 9,243.1 in the gold sector shares rallied but ended off their highs as the bullion prices zig-zagged on international markets between 326 and 328 dollars an ounce the golds index added 9.1 points to 1,026.1

latest gains in london metal exchange lme non-ferrous metals prices boosted by investment fund interest have led some analysts to suggest that they may signal another bull run in the sector on thursday zinc climbed to its best for nearly two years aluminium hit an eight-month peak tin and nickel rose to their best for four months and lead touched two-month highs and 1997 has also seen major investment houses issuing metal basket warrants and notes not seen since the last bull market `` it could be the return of 1993/94 when they were last issued '' said william adams of lme trader rudolf wolff and co earlier this week goldman sachs international issued warrants on a basket of metals as well as call warrants on copper zinc aluminium and its commodity index on thursday union bank of switzerland ubs launched a 100 million issue linked to the value of aluminium copper platinum and crude oil traders said these instruments which have a bias towards calls and could well be followed by others in coming weeks were positive for the metals market `` i do seem to remember that there were a whole host of them a couple of years ago they seemed to snowball as well '' one trader said `` we get bullish when we see this as the metal is going into strong hands '' another added he said that the institutions involved in that niche of the market would typically have buyers lined up for the issues and would already have their hedge cover in place this influx of investment fund money has implications for longer-term metal price movements as well analysts said `` consumers have not forgotten how they got caught in 1994 '' said nick moore of the flemings global mining group `` if 1997 is to be a re-run of 1994 then they would be unwise to twiddle their thumbs waiting for lower prices the time for bottom fishing has passed '' he added wolff 's adams noted that in the previous bull-run the investment-fund rally lifted prices at a time when metal inventories were rising and were at much higher levels `` there is much more potential now as stock levels are lower if they funds come in '' he said prices for lme metals this year in /tonne with end-1996 levels were as follows israeli shares closed sharply lower on thursday in thin trading amid sales by mutual funds traders said `` activity is low and the mood in the market is negative in the near future the market will continue to decline because investors are moving to more attractive investments '' a trader said `` everything depends now on progress made in the middle east peace process if there 's no breakthrough in the talks the market has no future '' he said israeli-palestinian talks were renewed this week following recent clashes that killed 74 people the benchmark mishtanim index of the top 100 shares fell 2.03 percent or 3.76 points to 181.68 on low turnover of 54 million shekels against 40 million on wednesday the maof 25 blue chip index lost 2.12 percent to 191.05 `` activity rose slightly today but the fact that the market is falling on higher volume is a bad sign the main sellers were the big mutual funds and this had a very negative impact on trading '' said ari eidelhet at central securities corp `` with such a low turnover every big seller affects the market immediately '' eidelhet said blue square chain closed unchanged at 2,411 ubs rated the company a `` buy '' noting they are trading at a large discount to its parent traded on the new york stock exchange the most active shares were teva pharmaceutical industries which fell 1.75 percent to 138,868 on volume of 4.7 million shekels koor industries which lost 2.0 percent to 27,008 on volume of 3.5 million shekels and bank hapoalim which fell 1.0 percent to 434 on turnover of 2.8 million shekels dan gerstenfeld tel aviv newsroom 972-3-537-2211

italian stocks closed generally higher helped up by lira and bond market strength on thursday with trade thin ahead of a three-day weekend beginning friday the blue-chip mib30 index closed 0.37 percent up at 14452 while the all-share mibtel stood 0.4 percent higher at 9626 total volume reached 460 billion lire of which some 120 billion lire was entirely down to trading on shares in state-controlled energy group eni mobile phone group tim climbed 3.19 percent to 3135 lire per ordinary share buyers were encouraged by results for the first nine months of this year tim 's digital gsm service had an operating result of just over 100 billion lire tim also decided to buy from its parent state telecoms holding stet a 49 percent stake in stet mobile holding giving it a potential foothold in the french mobile phone market stet itself was buffeted by various developments and eventually ended down 0.81 percent at 5259 lire managing director ernesto pascale was placed under investigation in a corruption probe in the north west italian town of aosta in the saga of stalled draft legislation to create a watchdog for italy 's telecoms and broadcasting sectors the far-right national alliance party said it was withdrawing obstructionist amendments to the bill meanwhile a far-left communist refoundation economic spokesman said an agreement between the government and the hard left could be found on creating a telecom authority the spokeman said the two camps positions were not irreconcilable and latest treasury suggestions were alright creation of a watchdog is essential to the privatisation of stet which the government wants to carry out before march 31 next year state energy company eni continues to attract high turnover although it ended at odds with the overall market down 0.07 percent at 7256 lire traders said the milan stock market is closed on friday and trading resumes on monday

cbot wheat futures closed mixed with nearby december dropping late on commercial selling with talk turkey may turn back shipments of u.s. wheat also mentioned traders said traders said cargill inc and merrill lynch futures each sold nearly two million bushels of december near the close wheat held firm much of the session on an impressive recovery in soybeans and on a short-term technical bounce `` it was a little technical correction early gains a little demand surfaced as u.s. soft red winter became mildly competitive '' said skip searcy of fimat futures but `` long term wheat trends remain bearish '' he said concerns about the fate of u.s. wheat exports to turkey apparently stemmed from rumors turkey may be clamping down on inspections of u.s. wheat cargoes `` it sounds as if the government is starting some kind of zero-tolerance program '' an mge trader said adding that the concerns included vomitoxin and tck smut wheat closed one cent pwer bushel lower to two cents higher with december down one at 3.98-1/2 and march down 1/2 at 3.91 technical indicators in wheat remain bearish traders said the key moving averages ma show the market remains poised for further declines with the four-day ma for december closing at 4.01 18-day at 4.19 and 40-day at 4.28-3/8 but the short term nine day relative strength index rsi for december ended at 21.995 points the market generally enough supplies of imported gold in india and poor demand in pakistan may keep prices down in the sub-continent during the next few days dealers said on monday they said indian demand coming mainly from wedding season buying could match increased arrivals of imported metal may cushion the downward pressures `` a weak global trend and relatively firm local prices have triggered higher imports of gold by indian expatriates said bhayabhai sanghvi a leading dealer in the week to monday standard gold fell 30 rupees per 10 grammes to 4,750 rupees on the bombay bullion market as supplies of imported gold outmatched demand dealers estimate the cost of imported gold at around 4,720 rupees per 10 grammes which left a margin of 30 rupees on 10 kgs of gold that indian expatriates are allowed to bring in once every six months the margin works out to 30,000 rupees `` profit margins are attractive enough to import gold at present '' sanghavi said `` going by the weak world trend any price rise in the local market will be short-lived '' sanghavi said `` the market is more or less likely to remain subdued to steady in the coming days '' dealers in pakistan 's commercial city of karachi said gold prices are likely to remain mixed in the current week because of subdued demand inflation had curtailed savings and eroded the people 's purchasing power said dealer farooq qureshi at the karachi saraffa bullion market in dubai traders and wholesalers on sunday reported strong demand for the metal from india which helped compensate for a downturn in the gulf arab emirate 's own retail market dubai is a key distribution hub for india a leading gold consuming nation `` indian demand is very strong it is wedding season now and prices are low ... it will probably stay like this until the beginning of the monsoon in june '' said a dubai trader alhough indian sub-continent bullion demand traditionally tails off during monsoons from june to september traders said prices at current levels continued to fan demand there buoyant indian demand is expected to push dubai 's bullion imports to over 400 tonnes this year from 350 tonnes in 1996 according to analysts gold prices 24 carats u.s. debt futures finished mostly lower erasing the day 's gains in light volume following the treasury 's five-year note auction traders said `` despite the price action we 've pretty much held in here '' one floor source said september t-bonds fell to 108-20/32 in reaction to the auction which produced an average yield of 6.568 percent versus estimates of 6.55 percent the bid-to-cover ratio was 2.13 and noncompetitive bids were at 534 million the 108-20/32 level was monday 's low and also represents the 3-1/2-week settlement low however september t-bonds did not linger at the day 's lows and settled above the 100-day moving average at 108-23/32 while eurodollars also ended above their day 's lows most eurodollars settled unchanged even though selling was more aggressive in the eurodollar pit and the calender spreads widened out for instance the september to september 1997 spread widened more than 0.80 from about 0.40 one trader said `` but again we are not seeing a lot of volume '' he said adding that total estimated volume was 250,000 likewise estimated bond futures volume was around 280,000 with most of the volume attributed to traders rolling positions in september into december while the september contract does not expire until september 19 december becomes the lead contract month at the start of friday 's pit session one large u.s. firm sold 3,000 september bonds at the opening and then bought 2,000 september later in the day traders were mixed on whether or not buying would once again in the tokyo and london markets some attributed the strong foreign bid merely to the dollar/yen rally while others said foreign central bank buying would continue some traders said nervousness ahead of thursday 's weekly u.s. jobless claims report and the revised second-quarter real gross domestic product report could contain overnight losses claims are expected to rise to 330,000 versus 327,000 in the previous week while real gdp is seen up 4.2 percent at the end of pit trade september bonds were off 05/32 at 108-25/32 10-year notes were off 02/32 at 107-07/32 munibonds were up 10/32 114-27/32 december eurodollars were unchanged at 94.08 march eurodollars were also steady at 93.91 and march t-bills were also flat at 94.50 derivatives desk 312-408-8750 e-mail derivatives reuter.com

croatian stocks ended the year firmer in unexpectedly brisk trade on tuesday but analysts said an extended festive mood would slow market activity until late january `` trading on smaller volumes is commonplace at the end of the year so today was an exceptional day '' said josko milisa of the i.f.c brokerage he said no big developments would shake the market before the second half of january `` but i expect the zagreb bourse will be more energetic next year in line with croatia 's economic development '' he said five of eight issues that traded on tuesday rose two fell and one was flat volume doubled to 5,142 shares turnover also up at 7.6 million kuna fully-listed zagrebacka banka lost 20 kuna to close at 1,060 it was the most active issue selling 3,676 shares in a single transaction its gdrs trading on seaq international in london edged down to 20.375 after hitting 20.75 earlier this week the bank 's e-series rose 20 kuna to 450 trading 31 units another fully-listed stock drugs firm pliva traded flat at 14,000 kuna with 241 shares changing hands traders said both were poised for further growth in the new year top gainer cable maker elka jumped 55 kuna to close at 195 selling 18 shares in a first deal in two weeks milisa said the gain followed the company 's announcement of good profit in 1996 and favourable forecast for the year ahead traders said demand for both chocolate maker kras and food processor podravka was on the rise kras rose 30 kuna to 450 selling 114 shares food processor podravka was up 18 kuna to 231 after peaking at 235 kuna it sold 919 units biggest decliner hotelier jadranturist lost 15 kuna to 220 with 124 shares sold milisa said the stock could become more active in 1997

nyce cotton closed slightly down in rangebound and featureless activity market sources said prices should move higher as speculators believed to be holding heavy net short positions basis the july will have to buy in order to offset those positions prior to the contract 's expiry on june 24 trade selling should blunt gains however forcing the market to trade in a mostly sideways pattern before the u.s. department of agriculture releases its revised estimate of planted cotton area the march estimate put area at 14.48 million acres but industry sources believe that number has declined tuesday private analyst sparks cos pegged planted area at 13.89 million acres traders also await thursday 's weekly export and sales report the new-crop december contract settled at 75.40 cents a lb down 0.14 cent spot july ended 0.13 lower at 72.53 cents while the rest of the board finished 0.07 higher to 0.15 lower as of early tuesday open interest in july stood at 17,793 lots down 1,378 lots from the previous session trade scale-up selling could cap gains around 76.00 cents in the december contract but floods and rain in the delta could provide some support for new-crop futures analysts said volume was estimated at 11,500 lots compared with tuesday 's official 11,618 lots suzanne rostler new york commodity desk 212-859-1646

canadian bonds opened weaker on wednesday with a softer canadian dollar and weakness in u.s. treasuries weighing on prices analysts said `` it 's mainly concern about the currency this morning i do n't think the numbers necessarily had so much to do with it although they were pretty strong numbers '' said arve bendiksrud a fixed-income analyst with td securities inc. `` the fact that the u.s. market is a little bit weaker gives the canadian market a bounce weaker as well '' canada 's 30-year benchmark bond fell c 0.21 to c 116.46 to yield 6.716 percent the u.s. 30-year bond fell 8/32 to yield 6.71 percent the spread between the bonds narrowed to one basis point from two basis points at tuesday 's close the canadian dollar opened weaker at c 1.3928 us 0.7179 in after the unit traded in a narrow and weak range last night in overseas markets trader said the currency weakened further this morning to break past the key c 1.3950 level the currency trended weaker despite relatively positive economic data out this morning statistics canada reported that average industrial weekly earnings rose a higher-than-expected 4.0 percent in april from a year earlier the government agency also reported that the country 's leading indicator rose 0.7 percent in may from april economists had forecast the indicator would rise by 0.8 percent in other prices canada 's 10-year benchmark bond fell c 0.27 to c 108.09 to yield 6.147 percent compared to its u.s. equivalent which fell 8/32 to yield 6.44 percent the negative spread between the bonds was 29 basis points unchanged from the close of trading on tuesday the three-month cash t-bill yielded 2.83 percent against its u.s. equivalent which yielded 5.15 percent jeffrey hodgson 416 941-8105 e-mail jeffrey.hodgson reuters.com
